title: Read Trump’s Letter to Congress About D.C. Police Department
description: In a letter to the House Oversight Committee, President Trump signaled his intent to temporarily take control of the Washington, D.C., police department and deploy 800 National Guard troops to the city.
content: THE WHITE HOUSE WASHINGTON August 11, 2025 Dear Representative Garcia: The District of Columbia is facing a crisis of violent crime. Our Nation's capital should symbolize American greatness, but violent crime and ineffective local policies threaten law and order in the heart of our Republic. Indeed, the District of Columbia now has a higher violent crime, murder, and robbery rate than all 50 States. As President of the United States, I have the obligation to ensure the safety and security of all Americans, including those who live and work in our Nation's capital. I must also ensure that our Federal institutions operate efficiently, without the preventable diversion of Federal resources to address the violent crime epidemic. Pursuant to my authority under section 740 of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act (Public Law 93-198), as amended (section 740), I have determined that special conditions of an emergency nature exist that require the use of the Metropolitan Police Department of the District of Columbia (Metropolitan Police force) for Federal purposes, including maintaining law and order in the Nation's seat of Government; protecting Federal buildings, national monuments, and other Federal property; and ensuring conditions necessary for the orderly functioning of the Federal Government. Accordingly, I informed the Mayor of the District of Columbia (Mayor) of this decision on August 11, 2025. The Mayor will provide to me the services of the Metropolitan Police force for Federal purposes until I have determined, in consultation with the Attorney General, that the emergency has ended or for the maximum period permitted under section 740. Sincerely, The Honorable Robert Garcia Committee on Oversight and Government Accountability House of Representatives Washington, D.C. 20515
summary: The President of the United States has written to Congress regarding a crisis of violent crime in the District of Columbia, citing the higher violent crime, murder, and robbery rate than all other states. He has authority to use the Metropolitan Police Department for Federal purposes, including maintaining law and order in the city, protecting Federal buildings, national monuments, and ensuring the orderly functioning of the Federal Government. The use of the police is permitted under section 740 of the District's Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act.
shortSummary: President Donald Trump's letter to Congress, citing severe violent crime and inadequate local policies, requires the use of the Metropolitan Police force for Federal purposes.
argos_summary: The White House has declared a state of emergency in the District of Columbia due to a significant rise in violent crime, surpassing rates in all 50 states. President Biden has invoked his authority to utilize the Metropolitan Police Department for federal purposes, including the protection of federal properties and maintaining order. This decision was communicated to the Mayor of D.C., with services to be provided until the emergency is resolved.
